text: We are having the same issue ... (since at least 21/10, last successful deployment on our side)

is that something to do with the new scopes you guys have introduced
```developer.app_functions.read developer.app_functions.write developer.projects.write```
which are not available to private API token's scopes ...
let me guess this is caused by the introduction of those scopes
available on personal key, and not on private app token
so this just mess up with all the github setup ...
Good morning everyone. Just coming online - 5am EST. I’ll see what I can do it may be until 8 or 9 am est because looks like this is tied the projects team.
As workaround, we recreate a personal key with the new scope then deploy manually, waiting for it to be repaired :pr:
were you able to successfuly build?
were you able to successfully build after regenerating the access key?
Hey Benjamin, sorry about this, this change wasn't supposed to go out yet. I am going to look into reverting this change.

We’re excited to hear what’s new, but I’m not sure I’ll be able to make the presentation. Is there anywhere else I can find out about new versions/features? The <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/release-log.html|release log> hasn’t been updated in 6 months. <https://www.npmjs.com/package/@HubSpot/cms-dev-server> shows lots of new version updates, but no info on what’s involved
cc <@UQNEXHW14>, <@U03KUBBCK2N>,
is it possible to just deploy the serverless function part of an app project instead of the whole thing? The react side of it takes much longer

<@U061NQ66Y6S> You should be able to use a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields#link|link> or <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields#url|url> field, and configure it to allow blog links through `supported_types`.
Good question, I think this is feedback for the projects team...
bat signal
Hello <@U06PNCY2EGG>, we hope you can make it to the presentation and I appreciate the nudge on this. We will get the missing release notes published in the coming weeks :fistbump:.
Y’all are amazing, thank you.

Thanks, this is fixed and I could deploy everything. However, the bug that the whole website breaks is still there. I can’t deploy anything during workhours since the chance it will break the website is above 50%.
Hi <@UAYBXDG4U>, <@ULKP20ZUN>, it works now, thanks a lot for your support :pray:

Hi everyone, I think I am running into a similar issue with the projects build error - I'm starting to get SASS deprecation warnings and another error reading source of undefined; Is there a workaround in the meantime as I'm unable to roll updates out.
